results.definition: forming or having the nature of a turning point or crisis
examples: a critical point in the campaign
a critical element of the plan

results.definition: at or of a point at which a property or phenomenon suffers an abrupt change especially having enough mass to sustain a chain reaction
examples: a critical temperature of water is 100 degrees C--its boiling point at standard atmospheric pressure

results.definition: being in or verging on a state of crisis or emergency
examples: an illness at the critical stage

results.definition: characterized by careful evaluation and judgment
examples: a critical analysis of Melville's writings

results.definition: marked by a tendency to find and call attention to errors and flaws
of or involving or characteristic of critics or criticism
